parameters.name: func
parameters.description: a function to apply to each child or parameter `item`

returnParameters.description: new xml value containing result of applying function `func` to each child or parameter `item`

functions.name: 'map
functions.description:
Applies a function to each item in an xml sequence, and returns an xml sequence of the results.

Each item is represented as a singleton value.

returnParameters.description: xml sequence containing the children of each element x concatenated in order

functions.name: children
functions.description:
Returns the children of elements in an xml value.

When parameter `x` is of type `Element`, it is equivalent to function `getChildren`.
This is equivalent to `elements(x).map(getChildren)`.

parameters.name: xs
parameters.description: xml or string items to concatenate

returnParameters.description:
an xml sequence that is the concatenation of all the parameter `xs`;
an empty xml sequence if the parameter `xs` is empty

functions.name: concat
functions.description: Concatenates xml and string values.

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: the content of the comment to be constructed.

returnParameters.description: an xml sequence consisting of a comment with parameter  `content` as the content

functions.name: createComment
functions.description: Creates a new xml comment item.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: the name of the new element

parameters.name: children
parameters.description: the children of the new element

returnParameters.description:
an xml sequence consisting of only a new xml element with parameter `name` as the name,
no attributes, and parameter `children` as the children

functions.name: createElement
functions.description: Creates a new xml element item.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: the target part of the processing instruction to be constructed

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: the content part of the processing instruction to be constructed

returnParameters.description:
an xml sequence consisting of a processing instruction with parameter `target` as the target 
and parameter `content` as the content

functions.name: createProcessingInstruction
functions.description: Creates a new xml processing instruction item.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: the character data of the Text item

returnParameters.description: an xml sequence that is either empty or consists of one text item

functions.name: createText
functions.description:
Constructs an xml value of type Text.

The constructed sequence will be empty when the length of parameter `data` is zero.

returnParameters.description: a string consisting of all the character data of parameter `x`

functions.name: data

parameters.name: nm
parameters.description: the expanded name of the elements to be selected, or `()` for all elements

functions.name: elementChildren
functions.description:
Selects element children of an xml value.

This is equivalent to `children(x).elements(nm)`.

parameters.name: nm
parameters.description: the expanded name of the elements to be selected, or `()` for all elements

returnParameters.description:
an xml sequence consisting of all the element items in parameter `x` whose expanded name is parameter `nm`,
or, if parameter `nm` is `()`, all element items in parameter `x`

functions.name: elements

parameters.name: func
parameters.description: a predicate to apply to each item to test whether it should be selected

returnParameters.description: new xml sequence containing items in parameter `x` for which function `func` evaluates to true

functions.name: filter
functions.description:
Selects the items from an xml sequence for which a function returns true.

Each item is represented as a singleton value.

parameters.name: func
parameters.description: a function to apply to each item in parameter `x`

functions.name: forEach
functions.description:
Applies a function to each item in an xml sequence.

Each item is represented as a singleton value.

returnParameters.description: xml value resulting from parsing parameter `s`, or an error

functions.name: fromString
functions.description:
Constructs an xml value from a string.

This parses the string using the `content` production of the
XML 1.0 Recommendation.

returnParameters.description: the item with index parameter `i` in parameter `x`

functions.name: get
functions.description:
Returns the item of an xml sequence with given index.

This differs from `x[i]` in that it panics if
parameter `x` does not have an item with index parameter `i`.

returnParameters.description: attributes of parameter `x`

functions.name: getAttributes
functions.description:
Returns the map representing the attributes of an xml element.

This includes namespace attributes.
The keys in the map are the expanded names of the attributes.

returnParameters.description: children of parameter `elem`

functions.name: getChildren
functions.description: Returns the children of an xml element.

returnParameters.description: the content of parameter `x`

functions.name: getContent
functions.description: Returns the content of a processing instruction or comment item.

returnParameters.description: descendants of parameter `elem`

functions.name: getDescendants
functions.description:
Returns the descendants of an xml element.

The descendants of an element are the children of the element
together with, for each of those children that is an element,
the descendants of that element, ordered so that
each element immediately precedes all its descendants.
The order of the items in the returned sequence will thus correspond
to the order in which the first character of the representation
of the item would occur in the representation of the element in XML syntax.

returnParameters.description: element name

functions.name: getName
functions.description: Returns a string giving the expanded name of an xml element.

returnParameters.description: target part of parameter `x`

functions.name: getTarget
functions.description: Returns the target part of the processing instruction.

returnParameters.description: iterator object

functions.name: iterator
functions.description:
Returns an iterator over the xml items of an xml sequence.

# Each item is represented by an xml singleton.

returnParameters.description: number of xml items in parameter `x`

functions.name: length
functions.description: Returns number of xml items in an xml value.

parameters.name: children
parameters.description: xml or string to set as children

functions.name: setChildren
functions.description:
Sets the children of an xml element.

This panics if it would result in the element structure
becoming cyclic.

functions.name: setName
functions.description: Changes the name of an XML element.

returnParameters.description: a subsequence of parameter `x` consisting of items with index >= parameter `startIndex` and < parameter `endIndex`

functions.name: slice
functions.description: Returns a subsequence of an xml value.

returnParameters.description: `x` with insignificant parts removed

functions.name: strip
functions.description:
Strips the insignificant parts of the an xml value.

Comment items, processing instruction items are considered insignificant.
After removal of comments and processing instructions, the text is grouped into
the biggest possible chunks (i.e., only elements cause division into multiple chunks)
and a chunk is considered insignificant if the entire chunk is whitespace.

returnParameters.description: an xml sequence consisting of selected text items

functions.name: text
functions.description: Selects all the items in a sequence that are of type `xml:Text`.

constants.name: base
constants.description: The expanded name of the `xml:base` attribute.

constants.name: lang
constants.description: The expanded name of the `xml:lang` attribute.

constants.name: space
constants.description: The expanded name of the `xml:space` attribute.

constants.name: XML_NAMESPACE_URI
constants.description: The namespace URI bound to the `xml` prefix.

constants.name: XMLNS_NAMESPACE_URI
constants.description: The namespace URI bound to the `xmlns` prefix.

types.name: Comment
types.description:
Type for singleton comments.
Built-in subtype of xml.

types.name: Element
types.description:
Type for singleton elements.
Built-in subtype of xml.

types.name: ItemType
types.description:
A type parameter that is a subtype of any singleton or empty xml sequence.
Has the special semantic that when used in a declaration
all uses in the declaration must refer to same type.

types.name: ProcessingInstruction
types.description:
Type for singleton processing instructions.
Built-in subtype of xml.

types.name: Text
types.description:
Type for zero or more text characters.
Built-in subtype of xml.
Adjacent xml text items are automatically concatenated,
so an xml sequence belongs to this type if it is a singleton test sequence
or the empty sequence.

types.name: XmlType
types.description:
A type parameter that is a subtype of `xml`.
Has the special semantic that when used in a declaration
all uses in the declaration must refer to same type.

modules.summary: The `lang.xml` module corresponds to basic type xml.
modules.description:
## Module Overview

The `lang.xml` module corresponds to basic type xml.
The `lang.xml` module corresponds to basic type xml.

functions.description:
Applies a function to each item in an xml sequence, and returns an xml sequence of the results.

Each item is represented as a singleton value.

Returns the children of elements in an xml value.

When parameter `x` is of type `Element`, it is equivalent to function `getChildren`.
This is equivalent to `elements(x).map(getChildren)`.
Concatenates xml and string values.
Creates a new xml comment item.
Creates a new xml element item.
Creates a new xml processing instruction item.

Constructs an xml value of type Text.

The constructed sequence will be empty when the length of parameter `data` is zero.

Selects element children of an xml value.

This is equivalent to `children(x).elements(nm)`.

Selects the items from an xml sequence for which a function returns true.

Each item is represented as a singleton value.

Applies a function to each item in an xml sequence.

Each item is represented as a singleton value.

Constructs an xml value from a string.

This parses the string using the `content` production of the
XML 1.0 Recommendation.

Returns the item of an xml sequence with given index.

This differs from `x[i]` in that it panics if
parameter `x` does not have an item with index parameter `i`.

Returns the map representing the attributes of an xml element.

This includes namespace attributes.
The keys in the map are the expanded names of the attributes.
Returns the children of an xml element.
Returns the content of a processing instruction or comment item.

Returns the descendants of an xml element.

The descendants of an element are the children of the element
together with, for each of those children that is an element,
the descendants of that element, ordered so that
each element immediately precedes all its descendants.
The order of the items in the returned sequence will thus correspond
to the order in which the first character of the representation
of the item would occur in the representation of the element in XML syntax.
Returns a string giving the expanded name of an xml element.
Returns the target part of the processing instruction.

Returns an iterator over the xml items of an xml sequence.

# Each item is represented by an xml singleton.
Returns number of xml items in an xml value.

Sets the children of an xml element.

This panics if it would result in the element structure
becoming cyclic.
Changes the name of an XML element.
Returns a subsequence of an xml value.

Strips the insignificant parts of the an xml value.

Comment items, processing instruction items are considered insignificant.
After removal of comments and processing instructions, the text is grouped into
the biggest possible chunks (i.e., only elements cause division into multiple chunks)
and a chunk is considered insignificant if the entire chunk is whitespace.
Selects all the items in a sequence that are of type `xml:Text`.

constants.description: The expanded name of the `xml:base` attribute.
The expanded name of the `xml:lang` attribute.
The expanded name of the `xml:space` attribute.
The namespace URI bound to the `xml` prefix.
The namespace URI bound to the `xmlns` prefix.

types.description:
Type for singleton comments.
Built-in subtype of xml.

Type for singleton elements.
Built-in subtype of xml.

A type parameter that is a subtype of any singleton or empty xml sequence.
Has the special semantic that when used in a declaration
all uses in the declaration must refer to same type.

Type for singleton processing instructions.
Built-in subtype of xml.

Type for zero or more text characters.
Built-in subtype of xml.
Adjacent xml text items are automatically concatenated,
so an xml sequence belongs to this type if it is a singleton test sequence
or the empty sequence.

A type parameter that is a subtype of `xml`.
Has the special semantic that when used in a declaration
all uses in the declaration must refer to same type.
